titleStmt.title: Jordan W. Young, Benjamon Young, and Randel W. Young to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4150

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excellency the Governor of Kentucky Thomas E Bramlette your petitioners Ben Young Jordan Young & Randal Young, State that at the February term of the . They were fined forty dollars each amounting in the whole to one hundred and twenty dollars which fine incurres to the Commonwealth of Ky After deducting the per cent of the commonwealths Attorney and costs of suit. A malicious prosecution in the name of the Commonwealth had been set on foot by an individual by the name of Daniel Geo. who was and is an enemy of these defendant (Petitioners) alleging a trespass to real and personal property, and mainly by his evidence alone they were fined. They state that they are innocent that they never committed any offense and that the whole thing was malicious, and unfounded from the beginning. They state that they are poor, and unable to pay that amount and if compelled to do so will be deprived of the means of support. They therefore ask that your executive Franklin circuit court held in 1863excellency clemency be extended towards them, and that said fine be remitted so much as goes to the Commonwealth. The Petitioners Ben Young Jordan Young and Randall Young state that the foregoing petition is true

Names
Jese Simpson
W. B. Searcy
Taylor Jamison
Benjamin M. Cox
Jefferson J Satterwhite

Bluford Watts
J Droffen,
I was the attor in this case for the young and think the fine ought to be remited --
Ben Young Jordan Young and Randal Young the foregoing named defts state that the above peition is true this the 18th day of Sept 1863.

Jordan W Young
Benjamon Young
Randel W Young
sbcribd befor and sworned two before me September the 18 1863
I see no sufficient reason for Executive interposition
